problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCD shape is a combination of a rectangle and a semi-circle, the perimeter of the ABCD shape is 64 and the diagonal of the BFGC square is 19, compute the length of the AB side of the ABCD shape. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 14764.869999999999)
C = (13469.259999999998, 14764.869999999999)
D = (13469.259999999998, 34.23)
F = (34.23, 28199.899999999998)
G = (13469.259999999998, 28199.899999999998)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 16))

# Draw the green rectangle (A, B, C, D)
green_rectangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D], closed=True, color="green", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(green_rectangle)

# Draw the green semicircle
radius = 6751.7444212722
semicircle = patches.Wedge(center=((A[0] + D[0]) / 2, A[1]), r=radius, theta1=0, theta2=180, color="green", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(semicircle)

# Draw the cyan rectangle (B, F, G, C)
cyan_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, C], closed=True, color="cyan", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, G, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 20034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 35034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The diagonal of the BFGC square is 19, so the length of the BC side is $\frac{19}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{19}{1.41} = 13.48$. The perimeter of the ABCD shape is 64 and the length of the BC side is 13.48, so $2 * OtherSide + 13.48 + \frac{13.48 * 3.14}{2} = 64$. So $2 * OtherSide = 64 - 13.48 - \frac{13.48 * 3.14}{2} = 64 - 13.48 - \frac{42.33}{2} = 64 - 13.48 - 21.16 = 29.36$. Therefore, the length of the AB side is $\frac{29.36}{2} = 14.68$. Therefore the final answer is 14.68.
